title: The Most Comforting New Pasta Dishes in Boston
text:
The Most Comforting New Pasta Dishes in Boston All Jan 9, 2017, 4:16pm EST Lobster fra diavolo at Little Donkey Rachel Leah Blumenthal for Eater 
With temperatures falling and winter beginning to make itself known, there's nothing more comforting than a hearty bowl of pasta, and plenty of exciting new restaurants are pulling out all the stops on that front. 
Thus we present the Eater Boston Pasta Heatmap, an ever-evolving collection of the newest destinations in town (restaurants under a year old) that are serving up one or more pasta dishes you absolutely must eat. 
Originally published on December 8, 2016 and getting a slight update today (January 9, 2017), this map still recalls warmer days, featuring a lot of seafood, from uni bucatini at Waypoint to lobster paccheri at Bar Mezzana. Think we'll see more hefty bolognese dishes as the snow continues to pile up? 
Today's update includes the addition of Oak + Rowan in Boston's Fort Point. 
Notes about this map: Points are listed alphabetically, not ranked. Many of these menus change frequently, so you may not find these exact dishes at the restaurants, but you can't go wrong â€” every spot on this map knows how to make a killer pasta dish. Is there another new restaurant serving up excellent pasta that should be on our radar? Leave a comment below or . 1 Bar Mezzana 
Bar Mezzana does a lot of things very well, most notably the crudo and the pasta. For the latter, you can't go wrong with any of the options, but it's the silky, smooth lobster paccheri that you'll want to order again and again. Rachel Leah Blumenthal for Eater 360 Harrison Avenue
